ideas.pitch: think of it as what YouTube did to video, we will do to games. Ultra short and original formats by individual creators and small teams. Who would have thought 20 years ago that people would be watching ultra short clips more than TV or movies combined?
ideas.notes: only superficially would compete with AAA. In reality it'd help AAA companies acquire new talent and smaller studios early on and help spot trends in gaming. Not like Apple Arcade, because it's games almost straight from game jams, no complicated licensing, no commitment for players wanting to try something. Certified fresh content essentially
ideas.problem: gamers are fed up with repeats of the same game mechanics, AAA companies have trouble creating relevant content every year and as productions become more expensive, developing a AAA game becomes a bigger risk. Game developers want to work on their own projects and be recognized
ideas.monetization: looking at gaming revenue, the 2 major areas are mobile and in-game advertising. This would give companies a way of placing their products directly in games, making for a better experience. The short and small low-end nature of the games makes for great mobile candidates

Web development
System design
…

Companies pay to be able to Interview way more people in way less time

business:
